messages.content:
You are an expert London family-activities curator.

Return ONLY a valid JSON object. No markdown, no explanations.

CRITICAL MATCH CHECK:
- Strictly compare scraped pages to raw name, tags, schedules, AND descriptions.
- If ANY core mismatch exists, set "contentMatchesDescription": false and return ONLY { "contentMatchesDescription": false }.
- If NONE of the pages describe "Maddie Moate's Very Curious Christmas", set "contentMatchesDescription": false.

OUTPUT SPECIFICATION (only when contentMatchesDescription === true):
- "summary": string, 25–45 words — exciting, family-focused, enticing!
- "officialAgeAvailable": boolean (true only if site explicitly states age guidance like "suitable for ages 5–12")
- "minAge" / "maxAge": integers 0–18
  → If officialAgeAvailable === true → use the exact numbers stated.
  → If officialAgeAvailable === false → give your best RECOMMENDED realistic age range for this activity (do NOT use 0–18).
- "keywords": array of 32–50 lowercase single words (give plenty, we’ll trim to ≤30).
- "labels": exactly 3 short labels, e.g. ["indoor", "theatre", "christmas"].

Raw event descriptions (MUST compare to scraped pages for match):
Type: third-party
Description: Age recommendation: 4+

Activity name: Maddie Moate's Very Curious Christmas

Tags: family, kids, theatre

You are receiving the TOP 1 MOST RELEVANT pages from the official website (already ranked by relevance).

Each page contains both the full text (first 4000 chars) AND focused extracted sections (hours, age, price, description).

Synthesise information ACROSS ALL pages. Prioritise the extracted sections when they exist.

If NONE of the pages describe the activity "Maddie Moate's Very Curious Christmas", set "contentMatchesDescription": false. Otherwise it MUST be true.

=== Page 1 – Nimax Theatres | West End Shows & Box Office Tickets London (https://nimaxtheatres.com/) ===
Extracted key sections (use these first):
AGE → recommended to secure suitable seating. Visit our Access page to explore accessibility at each theatre.
Access performances, including Audio Described, British Sign Language Interpreted, Captioned, Chilled and Relaxed, are now available to purchase online. You can browse access performances on our show pages, in the Access Tickets & Performances section and our Access page.

Explore Nimax’s six West End venues—Apollo, Palace, Garrick & more. Book top musicals, plays & comedy directly via official box office.

The Play

DESCRIPTION → experience. By buying directly, you also benefit from excellent customer support, priority booking, easy ticket exchanges, and exclusive access to promotions or discounts. Plus, you’re directly supporting the venues and their ongoing contributions to London’s cultural landscape.
Which theatres does Nimax own and operate?
Nimax Theatres proudly operates seven prestigious West End venues including the Lyric – the oldest surviving theatre on Shaftesbury Avenue – Apollo, Duchess, Garrick, Palace, Vaudeville, and @sohoplace – the first purpose-built West End theatre in over 50 years. The theatres have a combined capacity of over 5,700 seats, entertaining more than 20,000 audience members every week. Nimax is home to long-running plays and musicals including Harry Potter and the Cursed Child, The Play That Goes Wrong, SIX, and Hadestown, in addition to presenting a busy and varied programme of comedy, concerts and children’s theatre.
How do I book Access tickets?
Each of our theatres is equipped with accessible facilities, and patrons can book wheelchair spaces, end of aisle seating, and central row seating across most performances at Nimax venues. Advanced booking is recommended to secure suitabl

Sign up to our newsletter

"*" indicates required fields
Name*
First Name*
Email*
Consent*
By signing up to our mailing list, you confirm that Nimax Theatres can contact you about events, offers and services. You can unsubscribe at any time. See our privacy policy for more information on how we handle your data.*
Explore Our Theatres
Nimax Theatres owns six of the most prestigious theatres in London’s West End, as well as operating the West End’s newest theatre @sohoplace. Home to some of the UK’s favourite shows entertaining more than 45,000 audience members a week.
Apollo Theatre
A beautiful, intimate playhouse home to acclaimed plays with world-renowned actors
Duchess Theatre
Renown for intimate productions and comedy hits, and the home of The Play That Goes Wrong
Garrick Theatre
A stunning, ornate theatre offering a wide ranging programme of plays, musicals, and comedy
Lyric Theatre
The oldest surviving theatre on Shaftesbury Avenue, boasting the largest playhouse and a legacy of hits
Palace Theatre
A grand former opera house with a sensational façade on the only island site in London, known for blockbuster premieres
Vaudeville Theatre
A charming playhouse hosting plays and variety shows, now home to the homegrown smash hit SIX
Why should I book with Nimax Theatres?
Purchasing directly from Nimax Theatres ensures you receive official tickets from the Box Office without any hidden fees. As the owner of some of London’s most prestigious West End venues, Nimax Theatres guarantees a seamless experience. By buying directly, you also benefit from excellent customer support, priority booking, easy ticket exchanges, and exclusive access to promotions or discounts. Plus, you’re directly supporting the venues and their ongoing contributions to London’s cultural landscape.
